course.title: Quantum Theory of Solids
course.description: Theory of the electron liquid, Fermi liquid theory. Ferromagnetism of metals, BCS theory of superconductivity. Lattice models of correlated electrons: antiferromagnetism. Graphene: semi metals and quantum phase transitions. Non-fermi liquids in correlated metals.
course.prerequisites: Physics 251a,b, an introductory course in solid state physics, or permission of instructor.
course.notes: Note: Physics 295b is also offered as Applied Physics 295b. Students may not take both for credit. Prerequisite: Physics 251a,b, an introductory course in solid state physics, or permission of instructor.
